DzPropertyParam Class Reference
[Shader Mixer Classes]

DzBrickParam for float, color, and string RSL types. Wraps a single property. More...

Detailed Description

DzBrickParam for float, color, and string RSL types. Wraps a single property.

See also:
DzShaderBrick

void DzPropertyParam::loadSection ( DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework to allow this object to load data for the given section. Derived classes override this method to read section data from the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to read from
sectionID The section ID of the section to read.

Reimplemented from DzBrickParam.

void DzPropertyParam::save ( DzOutFile *  file  )  const [virtual]

Virtual funtion that is called to allow this object to save itself to the native file format.

Parameters:
file The file to write the data to.

Reimplemented from DzBrickParam.

void DzPropertyParam::setDirection ( int  i  )  [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
i The direction to set this param to. Should be either DzBrickParam::None or DzBrickParam::In
void DzPropertyParam::setPointer ( const DzInFile *  file,
short  sectionID,
short  pointerID,
DzBase *  ptr 
) [virtual]

Called by the framework when reading a native file. Derived classes should override this method if they ever write out pointer values to the data file. This method will be called with the sectionID and pointerID that were given when writing the file out. The passed pointer may be shared so should not be deleted.

Parameters:
file The file being loaded
sectionID The ID of the file section being read
pointerID The ID of the pointer being read.
ptr The pointer being read.

Reimplemented from DzBrickParam.

const QString &  arg,
const QString &  mapArg 
) [virtual, slot]
Parameters:
prop The property to wrap with this param
arg The arg name for the property
mapArg The map arg name or a null string if this property is not mapped

onoff Set whether or not to write this parameter in the shader
